casebody.data:
WILLIAM B. NEWBERRY, et al., Appellants, v. MICHAEL W. WALL, Respondent.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Speir and Russell, JJ.

Decided December 22, 1880. This is an appeal from a judgment entered upon a dismissal of the complaint at the trial term. The cause had been tried once before, and is reported in 35 Super. Ct. 106. At that trial the case was also dismissed. The general term affirmed the court below, and from that decision the plaintiffs appealed to the court of appeals, where the judgment was affirmed (65 N. Y. 484). Henry Whittaker, attorney, and F. R. Coudert, of counsel, for appellant. Huntley & Bowen, for respondent. Per Curiam.

Judgment affirmed, with costs.
